author: felicepantaleo
body:
#### PR description:
HGCal Layer Clustering is in the top 5 main offenders in computing resources in Phase 2 reconstruction.
Clustering on layer is done using CLUE algorithm, which is using a KD-Tree for speeding up nearest neighbor search.
However, the KD-Tree is :
- hard to build on a GPU
- expensive if the search-box is small with respect to the point cloud volume
- the number of dimensions is small

This PR replaces the KD-Tree with a Tiling data structure.
This allows to achieve a speed-up of **1 order of magnitude** in PU200 conditions, making the Layer Clustering negligible with respect to the rest of the Phase-2 reconstruction.

#### PR validation:
This is the original timing of 10_6_0_pre4 on TTbar PU200:
http://fpantale.web.cern.ch/fpantale/timing/html/original_10_6_0_pre4_PU200.html

With this PR:
http://fpantale.web.cern.ch/fpantale/timing/html/tiling_10_6_0_pre4_PU200.html

You can see that timing for the hgcalLayerClusters module goes from _5.81s_ to _0.57s_

Physics validation was also carried out with negligible differences due to the change of logic in assignment of the cluster id:

http://fpantale.web.cern.ch/fpantale/hgcal_validation_plots/histo_cpu_PU200/

title: [HGCal] Use tiling for speeding up CLUE algo nearest neighbor search
